Sentencas: Thermal cycling was conducted on compressive mica seals at 800 degreesC in air.
Titulo: Thermal cycling and degradation mechanisms of compressive mica-based seals for solid oxide fuel cells
Thermal cycling and degradation mechanisms of compressive mica-based seals for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Muscovite mica was pressed between a metal pipe and an alumina substrate and tested for leak rates at a stress of 100 psi in the plain (mica only) and the hybrid design.
Titulo: Thermal cycling and degradation mechanisms of compressive mica-based seals for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The hybrid design involves adding two glass interlayers and was found to greatly reduce the leak rates in an earlier paper Two metals (Inconel #600 and SS430) with high and low coefficients of thermal expansion (CTE) were used to evaluate the effect of CTE mismatch on thermal cycling.
Titulo: Thermal cycling and degradation mechanisms of compressive mica-based seals for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The results showed that the leak rates were lower for the hybrid design than the plain micas.
Titulo: Thermal cycling and degradation mechanisms of compressive mica-based seals for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In addition, wing the lower CTE (SS430) metal pipe resulted in lower leak rates as compared to Inconel #600 metal (high CTE).
Titulo: Thermal cycling and degradation mechanisms of compressive mica-based seals for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In general, the leak rates increased with the number of thermal cycles: however, it tended to level off after several tens of thermal cycles.
Titulo: Thermal cycling and degradation mechanisms of compressive mica-based seals for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Microstructure examination using, canning electron microscopy revealed steps, indents, fragmentation and particle formation on the mica after thermal cycling.
Titulo: Thermal cycling and degradation mechanisms of compressive mica-based seals for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: CTE measurement of the heat-treated Muscovite mica showed a relatively low value of similar to7 ppm/degreesC. The cause for the degradation of the mica is discussed.
Titulo: Thermal cycling and degradation mechanisms of compressive mica-based seals for solid oxide fuel cells
Thermal cycling and degradation mechanisms of compressive mica-based seals for solid oxide fuel cells
Thermal cycling and degradation mechanisms of compressive mica-based seals for solid oxide fuel cells
Thermal cycling and degradation mechanisms of compressive mica-based seals for solid oxide fuel cells
